meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of one short syllable followed by one long syllable.
meanings.sent1: The poet used an iambi to create rhythm in the poem.
meanings.sent2: The iambi in the verse made it flow smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The iambi danced through the lines of the poem.
meanings.sent4: Her words moved like an iambi, gracefully stepping along.
meanings.sent5: The iambi beat of the verse echoed in my mind.

meanings.definition: A metrical line of verse consisting of one or more iambs.
meanings.sent1: The iambi added a musical quality to the stanza.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a beautiful iambi in her poem.
meanings.sent3: The iambi in the verse sang a sweet melody.
meanings.sent4: His iambi of words painted a vivid picture.
meanings.sent5: The iambi of the line resonated with emotion.
